","keccak256":"0xcef50f95b43b038aa40aed25b62fc45906c681a5c1d504a4fdcf3bc6330a8d4b","license":"MIT"},"contracts/StablePro.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BSL 1.1

/*
  Copyright 2020 Unit Protocol: Artem Zakharov (az@unit.xyz).
*/
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "./periphery/contracts/access-control/SuAuthenticated.sol";
import "./gain-erc20/GainErc20v3Upgradeable.sol";

/**
 * @title StablePro
 * @notice ERC-20 token with GainableERC20 feature
 * @dev See GainableERC20v3Upgradeable contract for more details.
**/
contract StablePro is GainableERC20v3Upgradeable {
    function initialize(address _authControl) public initializer {
        // TODO: rename on mainnet
        __ERC20_init(_authControl, "Some USD", "SomeUSD");
    }

    /**
      * @notice Only Vault can mint StablePro. Dollars can be minted by vault (once user deposited collateral)
      * @dev Mints 'amount' of tokens to address 'to', and MUST fire the
      * Transfer event
      * @param to The address of the recipient
      * @param amount The amount of token to be minted
     **/
    function mint(address to, uint256 amount) external onlyMintAccess {
        _mint(to, amount);
    }

    /**
     * @notice dollars can be burned by manager but only his own dollars
     * which managers will be using this feature? burning protocol fees?
     **/
    function burn(uint256 amount) external onlyMintAccess {
        _burn(msg.sender, amount);
    }

    /**
     * @notice also vault is allowed to burn dollars of any account
     * when user repays his loan and takes back his collateral
     **/
    function burn(address from, uint256 amount) external onlyMintAccess {
        _burn(from, amount);
    }
}

// OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v4.5.0) (token/ERC20/ERC20.sol)

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/IERC20Upgradeable.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/ContextUpgradeable.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/math/SafeCastUpgradeable.sol";
import "../periphery/contracts/access-control/SuAuthenticated.sol";
import "../interfaces/IGainableERC20v3.sol";

contract GainableERC20v3Upgradeable is ContextUpgradeable, SuAuthenticated, IGainableERC20v3 {
    using SafeCastUpgradeable for uint256;
    using SafeCastUpgradeable for uint128;
    using SafeCastUpgradeable for uint64;
    using SafeCastUpgradeable for int256;

    uint256 private constant ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION = 1e12; // Constant precision factor
    uint256 public constant REWARD_PRECISION = 1e14; // Minimum reward unit, so min reward is 1e-4 unit cents
    IRewardPool public rewardPool; // Reward-related data.

    mapping(address => IAccount) public _accounts; // Stores user balances and reward debts.
    mapping(address => mapping(address => uint256)) private _allowances;

    uint256 private _totalSupply; // Total supply of the token

    string private _name;
    string private _symbol;

    // ==========================REWARDER================================
    uint256 public rewardPerBlock; // Amount of tokens distributed per block.
    uint256 public rewardEndBlock; // Block number when rewards end.

    function refillReward(uint256 amount, uint64 endBlock) public {
        if (block.number >= endBlock) revert BadEndBlock();
        updateRewardPool();

        transferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), amount);
        uint256 rewardLeftAmount;
        // if there are active rewards leftovers
        if (rewardEndBlock > 0) {
            // if we call refillReward before old endBlock ends
            if (block.number < rewardEndBlock) {
                rewardLeftAmount = rewardPerBlock * (rewardEndBlock - block.number);
            } else {
                // if we start the new reward interval that has nothing in common with the old noe
                rewardLeftAmount = 0;
            }
        }
        rewardPerBlock = (rewardLeftAmount + amount) / (endBlock - block.number);
        rewardEndBlock = endBlock;
    }

    function getTotalRewardsSinceLastUpdate() public view returns (uint256) {
        if (block.number <= rewardPool.lastRewardBlock || rewardEndBlock == 0) {
            return 0;
        }

        return block.number < rewardEndBlock
            ? (block.number - rewardPool.lastRewardBlock) * rewardPerBlock
            : (rewardEndBlock - rewardPool.lastRewardBlock) * rewardPerBlock;
    }

    function updateRewardPool() public {
        if (block.number > rewardPool.lastRewardBlock) {
            if (_totalSupply > 0) {
                rewardPool.accRewardPerShare = rewardPool.accRewardPerShare +
                            (getTotalRewardsSinceLastUpdate() * ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION / _totalSupply).toUint128();
            }
            rewardPool.lastRewardBlock = block.number.toUint64();
        }
    }

    function pendingRewards(address account) public view returns (uint256) {
        uint256 currentAccRewardPerShare = rewardPool.accRewardPerShare;
        if (block.number > rewardPool.lastRewardBlock && _totalSupply > 0) {
            currentAccRewardPerShare = currentAccRewardPerShare +
                (getTotalRewardsSinceLastUpdate() * ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION / _totalSupply);
        }

        // simulate harvest()
        IAccount memory user = _accounts[account];
        int256 accountReward = (user.balance * currentAccRewardPerShare / ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION).toInt256();
        uint256 pending = (accountReward - user.rewardDebt).toUint256();

        // Number prettier
        // on metamask the balanceOf sometimes gives too many digits after the comma
        // so balance looks ugly, for example: 12507.259801909711051452 StablePro
        // Since in any known fiat currency sub-cent values are essentially worthless, let's round them up if original
        // balance doesn't have many decimals - any number of additions of rounded values doesn't increase it
        return (pending / REWARD_PRECISION) * REWARD_PRECISION;
    }

    function harvest(address account) public {
        IAccount storage user = _accounts[account];
        updateRewardPool();
        int256 accRewards = (user.balance * rewardPool.accRewardPerShare / ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION).toInt256();
        uint256 _pendingRewards = (accRewards - user.rewardDebt).toUint256();
        _pendingRewards = (_pendingRewards / REWARD_PRECISION) * REWARD_PRECISION;

        // Effects
        user.rewardDebt = accRewards;

        // Interactions
        if (_pendingRewards != 0 && account != address(this)) {
            if (user.redirectYieldTo == address(0)) {
                _transfer(address(this), account, _pendingRewards, false); // to reduce amount of useless harvests
            } else {
                _transfer(address(this), user.redirectYieldTo, _pendingRewards, true);
            }
        }
    }

    function redirectYieldAndHarvest(address to) public {
        IAccount storage user = _accounts[msg.sender];

        harvest(msg.sender);
        if (to != address(0)) {
            harvest(to);
        }

        user.redirectYieldTo = to;
    }

    function cancelRedirectYieldAndHarvest() public {
        redirectYieldAndHarvest(address(0));
    }

    function redirectYieldAndHarvestByDAO(address from, address to) external onlyDAO {
        harvest(from);
        if (to != address(0)) {
            harvest(to);
        }
        _accounts[from].redirectYieldTo = to;
    }

    function getYieldAPR() public view returns (uint256) {
        if (block.number > rewardEndBlock) {
            return 0;
        }
        uint256 blocksPerYear = 4 * 60 * 24 * 365;

        return rewardPerBlock * blocksPerYear * 1e18 / _totalSupply;
    }
    //===================================================================
    // We need to disable custom-errors rule to behave like standard ERC20 token
    /* solhint-disable custom-errors */

    // solhint-disable-next-line func-name-mixedcase
    function __ERC20_init(address authControl_, string memory name_, string memory symbol_) internal onlyInitializing {
        __ERC20_init_unchained(authControl_, name_, symbol_);
    }

    // solhint-disable-next-line func-name-mixedcase
    function __ERC20_init_unchained(
        address authControl_,
        string memory name_,
        string memory symbol_
    ) internal onlyInitializing {
        _name = name_;
        _symbol = symbol_;
        __suAuthenticatedInit(authControl_);
    }

    function name() public view virtual returns (string memory) {
        return _name;
    }

    function symbol() public view virtual returns (string memory) {
        return _symbol;
    }

    function decimals() public view virtual returns (uint8) {
        return 18;
    }

    function totalSupply() public view virtual returns (uint256) {
        return _totalSupply;
    }

    function balanceOf(address account) public view virtual returns (uint256) {
        IAccount memory user = _accounts[account];

        return user.redirectYieldTo == address(0) ? user.balance + pendingRewards(account) : user.balance;
    }

    function transfer(address to, uint256 amount) public virtual returns (bool) {
        address owner = _msgSender();
        _transfer(owner, to, amount, true);
        return true;
    }

    function allowance(address owner, address spender) public view virtual returns (uint256) {
        return _allowances[owner][spender];
    }

    function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) public virtual returns (bool) {
        address owner = _msgSender();
        _approve(owner, spender, amount);
        return true;
    }

    function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 amount) public virtual returns (bool) {
        address spender = _msgSender();
        _spendAllowance(from, spender, amount);
        _transfer(from, to, amount, true);
        return true;
    }


    function increaseAllowance(address spender, uint256 addedValue) public virtual returns (bool) {
        address owner = _msgSender();
        _approve(owner, spender, _allowances[owner][spender] + addedValue);
        return true;
    }

    function decreaseAllowance(address spender, uint256 subtractedValue) public virtual returns (bool) {
        address owner = _msgSender();
        uint256 currentAllowance = _allowances[owner][spender];
        require(currentAllowance >= subtractedValue, "ERC20: decreased allowance below zero");
        unchecked {
            _approve(owner, spender, currentAllowance - subtractedValue);
        }

        return true;
    }

    function _transfer(address from, address to, uint256 amount, bool needHook) internal virtual {
        require(from != address(0), "ERC20: transfer from the zero address");
        require(to != address(0), "ERC20: transfer to the zero address");

        if (needHook) {
            _beforeTokenTransfer(from, to, amount);
        }

        uint256 fromBalance = _accounts[from].balance;
        require(fromBalance >= amount, "ERC20: transfer amount exceeds balance");
        unchecked {
            _accounts[from].balance = fromBalance - amount;
            _accounts[from].rewardDebt = (
                _accounts[from].balance * rewardPool.accRewardPerShare / ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION
            ).toInt256();
        }
        _accounts[to].balance += amount;
        _accounts[to].rewardDebt = (
            _accounts[to].balance * rewardPool.accRewardPerShare / ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION
        ).toInt256();

        emit Transfer(from, to, amount);

        if (needHook) {
            _afterTokenTransfer(from, to, amount);
        }
    }

    function _mint(address account, uint256 amount) internal virtual {
        require(account != address(0), "ERC20: mint to the zero address");

        _beforeTokenTransfer(address(0), account, amount);

        _totalSupply += amount;
        _accounts[account].balance += amount;
        _accounts[account].rewardDebt = (
            _accounts[account].balance * rewardPool.accRewardPerShare / ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION
        ).toInt256();
        emit Transfer(address(0), account, amount);

        _afterTokenTransfer(address(0), account, amount);
    }

    function _burn(address account, uint256 amount) internal virtual {
        require(account != address(0), "ERC20: burn from the zero address");

        _beforeTokenTransfer(account, address(0), amount);

        uint256 accountBalance = _accounts[account].balance;
        require(accountBalance >= amount, "ERC20: burn amount exceeds balance");
        unchecked {
            _accounts[account].balance = accountBalance - amount;
            _accounts[account].rewardDebt = (
                _accounts[account].balance * rewardPool.accRewardPerShare / ACC_REWARD_TOKEN_PRECISION
            ).toInt256();
        }
        _totalSupply -= amount;

        emit Transfer(account, address(0), amount);

        _afterTokenTransfer(account, address(0), amount);
    }

    function _approve(address owner, address spender, uint256 amount) internal virtual {
        require(owner != address(0), "ERC20: approve from the zero address");
        require(spender != address(0), "ERC20: approve to the zero address");

        _allowances[owner][spender] = amount;
        emit Approval(owner, spender, amount);
    }

    function _spendAllowance(address owner, address spender, uint256 amount) internal virtual {
        uint256 currentAllowance = allowance(owner, spender);
        if (currentAllowance != type(uint256).max) {
            require(currentAllowance >= amount, "ERC20: insufficient allowance");
            unchecked {
                _approve(owner, spender, currentAllowance - amount);
            }
        }
    }

    /**
     * @dev Hook that is called before any transfer of tokens. This includes
     * minting and burning.
     *
     * Calling conditions:
     *
     * - when `from` and `to` are both non-zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens
     * will be transferred to `to`.
     * - when `from` is zero, `amount` tokens will be minted for `to`.
     * - when `to` is zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens will be burned.
     * - `from` and `to` are never both zero.
     *
     * To learn more about hooks, head to xref:ROOT:extending-contracts.adoc#using-hooks[Using Hooks].
     */
    function _beforeTokenTransfer(address from, address to, uint256) internal {
        if (from != address(0)) {
            harvest(from);
        }
        if (to != address(0)) {
            harvest(to);
        }
    }

    /**
     * @dev Hook that is called after any transfer of tokens. This includes
     * minting and burning.
     *
     * Calling conditions:
     *
     * - when `from` and `to` are both non-zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens
     * has been transferred to `to`.
     * - when `from` is zero, `amount` tokens have been minted for `to`.
     * - when `to` is zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens have been burned.
     * - `from` and `to` are never both zero.
     *
     * To learn more about hooks, head to xref:ROOT:extending-contracts.adoc#using-hooks[Using Hooks].
     */
    // solhint-disable-next-line no-empty-blocks
    function _afterTokenTransfer(address from, address to, uint256 amount) internal virtual {}

    /* solhint-enable custom-errors */
    /**
     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new
     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.
     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps
     */
    uint256[45] private __gap;
}","keccak256":"0x07ac31b7d6b286a988c14ffa875441bf97826f96e00842771bad801a4e02b5c6","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IGainableERC20v3.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20MetadataUpgradeable.sol";

/**
 * @title IGainableERC20v3
 * @notice This is fork on openzeppelin ERC20Upgradeable v4.5.0
 * @dev Implementation of the {IERC20} interface.
 **/
interface IGainableERC20v3 is IERC20MetadataUpgradeable {
    /* ======================== STRUCT ========================= */
    struct IAccount {
        uint256 balance;
        int256 rewardDebt;
        address redirectYieldTo;
        // bool isGainDisabled;
    }

    struct IRewardPool {
        uint128 accRewardPerShare;
        uint64 lastRewardBlock;
    }

    /* ======================== ERRORS ========================= */
    error BadEndBlock();


    /* ==================== MUTABLE METHODS ==================== */

    /**
     * @notice Refills the "moneybox" with a specified amount of tokens
     * @param amount The amount of tokens to add to the reward pool
     * @param endBlock The block number at which the rewards will end
     * @dev This function updates the reward per block and end block for the reward distribution
     */
    function refillReward(uint256 amount, uint64 endBlock) external;

    /**
     * @notice Updates the reward pool state
     * @dev This function should be called to update the accumulated rewards per share and the last reward block
     */
    function updateRewardPool() external;

    /**
     * @notice Harvests rewards for a specified account
     * @param account The address of the account to harvest rewards for
     * @dev This function calculates and transfers pending rewards to the account or its designated yield recipient.
     * We won't make it private, because if user will send 1wei to any account, then harvest(to) will be called
     */
    function harvest(address account) external;

    /**
     * @notice Redirects yield to a specified address and harvests current rewards
     * @param to The address to redirect yield to (from msg.sender)
     * @dev This function allows users to redirect their yield to another address and immediately harvest current rewards.
     * To remove redirect just pass address(0) in argument
     */
    function redirectYieldAndHarvest(address to) external;

    /**
     * @notice Cancels yield redirection and harvests current rewards
     * @dev This function stops redirecting yield and harvests the current rewards for the caller
     */
    function cancelRedirectYieldAndHarvest() external;

    /**
     * @notice Allows the DAO to redirect yield for a user and harvest their rewards
     * @param from The address of the user whose yield is being redirected
     * @param to The address to redirect the yield to
     * @dev This function can only be called by the DAO and allows for administrative yield redirection
     */
    function redirectYieldAndHarvestByDAO(address from, address to) external;

    /**
     * @dev Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.
     *
     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
     * problems described in {IERC20-approve}.
     *
     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.
     *
     * Requirements:
     *
     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
     */
    function increaseAllowance(address spender, uint256 addedValue) external virtual returns (bool);

    /**
     * @dev Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.
     *
     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
     * problems described in {IERC20-approve}.
     *
     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.
     *
     * Requirements:
     *
     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
     * - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least
     * `subtractedValue`.
     */
    function decreaseAllowance(address spender, uint256 subtractedValue) external virtual returns (bool);

    /* ===================== VIEW METHODS ====================== */

    /**
     * @dev Calculates total amount of rewards allocated to the all pools on the rage (startBlock, endBlock]
     * i.e. excluding startBlock but including endBlock
     * @return The total amount of rewards allocated since the last update
     */
    function getTotalRewardsSinceLastUpdate() external view returns (uint256);

    /**
     * @notice Calculates the pending rewards for a given account
     * @param account The address of the account to check pending rewards for
     * @return The amount of pending rewards for the account
     * @dev This function calculates rewards without updating the state
     */
    function pendingRewards(address account) external view returns (uint256);

    /**
     * @notice Calculates the current yield Annual Percentage Rate (APR)
     * @return The current yield APR expressed as a percentage with 18 decimal places
     * @dev This function provides an estimate of the annual yield rate based on current rewards, especially for UI
     */
    function getYieldAPR() external view returns (uint256);
}

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

/**
 * @title SuAccessRoles Library
 * @dev SuAuthenticated and SuAccessControlSingleton need to have this constants
 * Hierarchy:
 *      1. DAO - can give admins and system roles
 *      2.1. Admin - can set Alerters
 *      2.2. System - includes Minter, Liquidation, Reward and Disabler roles, don't have access to give some roles.
 *      3. Alerter - can send alerts and trigger rate limits, don't have access to give some roles.
 */
abstract contract SuAccessRoles {
    bytes32 public constant ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;

    bytes32 public constant DAO_ROLE = keccak256("DAO_ROLE");

    bytes32 public constant ALERTER_ROLE = keccak256("ALERTER_ROLE");

    // system roles
    bytes32 public constant MINT_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("MINT_ACCESS_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant LIQUIDATION_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("LIQUIDATION_ACCESS_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE");
    // bytes32 public constant SYSTEM_ROLE = keccak256("SYSTEM_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant DISABLER_ROLE = keccak256("DISABLER_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant CDP_ACCESS_ROLE = keccak256("CDP_ACCESS_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant VOTING_ESCROW_ROLE = keccak256("VOTING_ESCROW_ROLE");
    bytes32 public constant PROXY_ACTIONS_ROLE = keccak256("PROXY_ACTIONS_ROLE");
}
","keccak256":"0x76c6b55446c0e7b40405cd0b642650c64a842e5dd71d5c5307f0b2def8898a1b","license":"BSL 1.1"},"contracts/periphery/contracts/access-control/SuAuthenticated.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BSL 1.1

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "../interfaces/access-control/ISuAccessControl.sol";
import "./SuAccessRoles.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/introspection/IERC165Upgradeable.sol";

/**
 * @title SuAuthenticated
 * @dev other contracts should inherit to be authenticated.
 * The address of SuAccessControlSingleton should be one for all contract that inherits SuAuthenticated
 */
abstract contract SuAuthenticated is Initializable, SuAccessRoles, IERC165Upgradeable {
    ISuAccessControl public ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON;

    error OnlyDAOError();
    error OnlyAdminError();
    error OnlyAlerterError();
    error OnlyVaultAccessError();
    error OnlyLiquidationAccessError();
    error OnlyMintAccessError();
    error OnlyRewardAccessError();
    error OnlyDisablerAccessError();
    error OnlyVotingEscrowError();
    error OnlyProxyActionsError();
    error OnlyRoleError();
    error OnlyCDPAccessError();
    error BadAccessControlSingleton();

    /**
     * @dev should be passed in constructor
     */
    function __suAuthenticatedInit(address _accessControlSingleton) internal onlyInitializing {
        ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON = ISuAccessControl(_accessControlSingleton);
        if (
            _accessControlSingleton == address(0) ||
            !ISuAccessControl(_accessControlSingleton).supportsInterface(type(IAccessControlUpgradeable).interfaceId)
        ) revert BadAccessControlSingleton();
    }

    /** CORE ROLES */

    modifier onlyDAO() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(DAO_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyDAOError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyAdmin() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyAdminError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyAlerter() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(ALERTER_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyAlerterError();
        _;
    }

    /** SYSTEM ROLES */

    modifier onlyLiquidationAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(LIQUIDATION_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyLiquidationAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyMintAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(MINT_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyMintAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyRewardAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyRewardAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyRewardOrAdminAccess() {
        if (
            !ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(REWARD_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender) &&
            !ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender)
        ) revert OnlyRewardAccessError();
        _;
    }

    // @notice This modifier check if user/contract have access to "disable" contracts.
    // All main contracts in our lending protocol have disableContract() method that stops contracts main functions.
    modifier onlyDisablerAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(DISABLER_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyDisablerAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyCDPAccess() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(CDP_ACCESS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyCDPAccessError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyVotingEscrow() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(VOTING_ESCROW_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyVotingEscrowError();
        _;
    }

    modifier onlyProxyActions() {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(PROXY_ACTIONS_ROLE, msg.sender)) revert OnlyProxyActionsError();
        _;
    }

    // syntax sugar under ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON
    modifier onlyRole(bytes32 role) {
        if (!ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.hasRole(role, msg.sender)) revert OnlyRoleError();
        _;
    }

    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual returns (bool) {
        return ACCESS_CONTROL_SINGLETON.supportsInterface(interfaceId);
    }
}

pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/IAccessControlUpgradeable.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/introspection/IERC165Upgradeable.sol";
import "../../access-control/SuAccessRoles.sol";

/**
 * @notice Access control for contracts
 * @dev External interface of AccessControl declared to support ERC165 detection.
 **/
interface ISuAccessControl is IAccessControlUpgradeable, IERC165Upgradeable {
    function setRoleAdmin(bytes32 role, bytes32 adminRole) external;
}

devdoc.details: See GainableERC20v3Upgradeable contract for more details.*

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.

cancelRedirectYieldAndHarvest().details: This function stops redirecting yield and harvests the current rewards for the caller

decimals().details: Returns the decimals places of the token.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getTotalRewardsSinceLastUpdate().details: Calculates total amount of rewards allocated to the all pools on the rage (startBlock, endBlock] i.e. excluding startBlock but including endBlock

returns._0: The total amount of rewards allocated since the last update

getYieldAPR().details: This function provides an estimate of the annual yield rate based on current rewards, especially for UI

returns._0: The current yield APR expressed as a percentage with 18 decimal places

harvest(address).details: This function calculates and transfers pending rewards to the account or its designated yield recipient. We won't make it private, because if user will send 1wei to any account, then harvest(to) will be called

params.account: The address of the account to harvest rewards for

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

mint(address,uint256).details: Mints 'amount' of tokens to address 'to', and MUST fire the Transfer event

params.amount: The amount of token to be minted*

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

pendingRewards(address).details: This function calculates rewards without updating the state

params.account: The address of the account to check pending rewards for

returns._0: The amount of pending rewards for the account

redirectYieldAndHarvest(address).details: This function allows users to redirect their yield to another address and immediately harvest current rewards. To remove redirect just pass address(0) in argument

params.to: The address to redirect yield to (from msg.sender)

redirectYieldAndHarvestByDAO(address,add.details: This function can only be called by the DAO and allows for administrative yield redirection

params.from: The address of the user whose yield is being redirected
params.to: The address to redirect the yield to

refillReward(uint256,uint64).details: This function updates the reward per block and end block for the reward distribution

params.amount: The amount of tokens to add to the reward pool
params.endBlock: The block number at which the rewards will end

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token.

totalSupply().details: Returns the amount of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `to`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

updateRewardPool().details: This function should be called to update the accumulated rewards per share and the last reward block

getYieldAPR().notice: Calculates the current yield Annual Percentage Rate (APR)

harvest(address).notice: Harvests rewards for a specified account

pendingRewards(address).notice: Calculates the pending rewards for a given account

redirectYieldAndHarvest(address).notice: Redirects yield to a specified address and harvests current rewards
